textos_fuente.text: Flamingo Island Flea Market in Bonita Springs sold Who's gonna win? SWFL previews, winner predictions for high school football Week 4 News Cape Coral Sports Opinion Restaurants Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals BONITA SPRINGS Flamingo Island Flea Market in Bonita Springs sold STEVE DOANE SDOANE@NEWS-PRESS.COM Bonita Springs' largest flea market is coming under new ownership. The Flamingo Island Flea Market was sold this week to a Colorado-based management company for $8.5 million after being quietly marketed. "There has been a lot of interest. It's a unique property and we wanted to find someone who could take it to the next level," said Dougall McCorkle, a senior sales associate with Premier Commercial. The market is located on 14.6 acres near Interstate 75 and Bonita Beach Road and has 170 vendors selling a wide variety of produce and goods from two buildings totaling 81,000 square feet. The facility opened in 1999. The property was assessed in 2014 for $3.2 million, according to Lee County land documents. The ownership group, Flamingo Island Market, Ltd., was the original developer. The buyer is identified on the deed as FIFM RE, LLC, but the company's address is associated with the Mile High Flea Market in Denver, one of the largest flea markets in the region. Attempts to contact the buyer were not returned. McCorkle and Michael Lynch of MLPA Realty brokered the sale as representatives for the sellers. The flea market is open from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m Friday-Sunday and last year attracted about 250,000 visitors, McCorkle said. The market is well-positioned in the region due to its proximity to two well-traveled roads and because vendors sell new goods, not used or cheaply made products. The new ownership is looking to capitalize on that and expand Flamingo Island's business. Flamingo Island Flea Market - COVID19 (513)-539-4497 320 N Garver Rd, Monroe, OH 45050 Sat & Sun 9am-5pm Book Your Space COVID-19 Updates COVID-19 Updates COVID-19 Updates Home Visit Sell About Contact COVID-19 UPDATES TREASURE AISLES SELLER & BUYER RULES We are open and operating full business hours. We are monitoring and following all local government guidelines regarding COVID 19. All of our team members are encouraged to wear masks. We are cleaning all high traffic areas more often and have sneeze guards installed at all concession stands and flea market office and entry points. Please follow the below rules to help protect us all and keep the flea market open. SELLER RULES â¢ All vendors and vendor employees must maintain social distance requirement of 6 feet at all times. â â¢All vendors and vendor employees must wear a face mask at all times. â â¢All vendors and vendor employees must stay within designated selling area at all times. â â¢No cutting or sampling of any produce items. â â¢Do not come to the market if you are sick. â â¢Please wash your hands and avoid touching your face. â â¢We encourage all vendors to arrive at the market with personal hand sanitizer, use it often. BUYER RULES â¢All buyers must maintain social distance requirement of 6 feet at all times. â â¢All buyers are required to wear masks/face covering while at the marketÂ â â¢Do not come to the market if you are sick. â â¢Please wash your hands and avoid touching your face. â â¢Please use a tissue or the inside of your elbow when you cough and/or sneeze and discard of the tissue properly. â â¢Wash your hands. â â¢Follow all posted signage around the market. Open every Friday, Saturday and Sunday. United Flea Markets Flamingo Island Flea Market is a proud member of United Flea Markets. United Flea Markets was born out of a passion for the enduring, contemporary flea market business that always adds fun, affordability and local flavor to its communities. United Flea Markets understands that experience and diversity represent an important component of a market's value. We are on a mission to listen, relate and evolve to build on the past success of those who have come before us. United Flea Markets was born out of a passion for the contemporary flea market —an enduring business model that creates fun, affordability and local flavor in the communities we call home. As owners and operators of diverse community flea markets around the country, United Flea Markets is growing with intention. We’re helping our new markets soar by balancing on-the-ground experience, solid capital, corporate resources and best-of-class operations with a highly creative and flexible approach, structure and perspective. dots Our Nationwide Markets See all Markets We’re on a mission to listen, relate and evolve to build on the past success of those who have come before us. Blog Preview United Flea Markets Embraces the Cloud: 15 Markets Upgrade to Booth Tracker Cloud In partnership with E-SoftSys , our trusted technology provider, we’ve completed a seamless migration from the legacy Booth Tracker setup to Booth Tracker Cloud, a move that brings real benefits to our daily operations. Read more Featured Market Treasure Aisles Flea Market Monroe, OH Established: 1991 Visitors annually: 500,000 Vendors weekly: 500 Read more We're owners and operators first. Why sell your market? Keeping the culture! dots Have a question? We'd love to hear from you. Send Message Working with United Flea Markets was incredibly simple, and integrating our company has been seamless. UFM has made sure over the past couple of years to maintain our great culture and keep our employees happy and inspired. United Flea Markets Acquires South Florida’s Flamingo Flea Market | United Flea Markets Menu × Home About Background Carrying on Legacies Approach Aquisitions Leadership/Ownership Team Markets Our Mission Mile High Flea Market Flamingo Island Flea Market T&W Flea Market Awesome Flea Market J&J Flea Market Ramona Flea Market Cooks Flea Market Mobile Flea Market Rubidoux Drive-in Theatre Swap Meet Keller's Flea Market Colorado Springs Flea Market Tanque Verde Swap Meet Fleamasters Flea Market Treasure Aisles Flea Market Cole's Flea Market News/Blog Contact Home About Background Carrying on Legacies Approach Aquisitions Leadership/Ownership Team Markets Our Mission Mile High Flea Market Flamingo Island Flea Market T&W Flea Market Awesome Flea Market J&J Flea Market Ramona Flea Market Cooks Flea Market Mobile Flea Market Rubidoux Drive-in Theatre Swap Meet Keller's Flea Market Colorado Springs Flea Market Tanque Verde Swap Meet Fleamasters Flea Market Treasure Aisles Flea Market Cole's Flea Market News/Blog Contact United Flea Markets Acquires South Florida’s Flamingo Flea Market May 15, 2015, Denver – United Flea Markets, owners of the successful Mile High Flea Market in Denver, have recently the Flamingo Island Flea Market in Bonita Springs, Fla. for an undisclosed amount. United Flea Markets plans to continue the successful operation of this Florida-based market while improving and enhancing the experience overall. “We have a deep understanding of the flea market business and the ever-changing needs and desires of both buyers and sellers,” said Rob Sieban, co-partner of United Flea Market and a member of the National Flea Market Association. “We will work diligently to deliver top-notch service to today’s consumers and entrepreneurs while maximizing opportunities to growth.” In addition to today’s acquisition news, United Flea Market is actively seeking additional investments in its portfolio of successful flea markets. “We bring small-company agility with finely tuned business acumen to our markets, and owners can rest assured that we value and respect their businesses.” According to the National Flea Market Association there are more than 1,100 flea markets that are visited by more than 150 million customers each year, totally more than $30 billion in annual sales. With 10 unique markets, Florida is among the popular states for flea markets. Flamingo Island Flea Market will continue to operate normally during the transition. United Flea Markets is committed to preserving the culture, integrity and community aspect of Flamingo Island and each market it works with. Flea markets owners interested in learning more about investments from United Flea Markets can visit unitedfleamarkets.com or call 303-289-4656. dots Home About Markets News/Blog Contact inquiries@unitedfleamarkets.com • 720.592.0260 7007 E. 88th Ave., Henderson, CO 80640 ©2025 United Flea Markets. Seller Resource Guide TOP 6 REASONS TO Sell at Flamingo Island # 1 Flexible Options You can sell for the day, weekend or the month. # 3 Affordable Start selling in an aisle space for as little as $24. # 2 No Long Term Commitment We do not require long term leases. # 4 Startup Business Have the ability to start your own business. # 6 Fun Fun Fun! Enjoy selling your stuff at Flamingo Island. # 5 Foot Traffic We welcome anywhere from 2,000-12,000 people a weekend. Vendor Info Rules / FAQ Know more about selling at Flaming Island Flea Market and check out our rules and regulations HERE. We require information to sell at the market, check out the required information HERE. WHEN CAN IÂ ACCESS MY INDOOR SPACE? Thursday 8a-4p and Fri/Sat/Sun 7a-8p CAN I SELL FIREARMS? No. CAN I SELL PETS? NO pet sales are allowed at the market at all. NO animals are allowed to be given away for FREE either. Only service animals are allowed on property. CAN I SELL FOOD AND DRINKS? Flamingo Island welcomes restaurants and food and beverage vendors. All food vendors must be approved by the Market General Manager. WHAT IS NOT PERMITTED TO BE SOLD AT THE MARKET? The following items are not permitted: dogs, cats, any other animals, baby food, infant formula, alcoholic beverages, illegal items, bootleg or counterfeit items, coin operated gumball or candy machines, petition signings, and any item deemed objectionable (at the sole discretion of Flamingo Island). Games of chance are not allowed. Adult and X-rated materials are not allowed. Additional rent may be required for certain items. The Market may not be used to further political agendas, parties, elections, issues, or candidates. HOW DO I BOOK A SPACE? You can call the office at 239-948-7799, go to the market Thursday - Sunday, 8am-4pm, show up the day of on the weekend OR fill out our Request to Book a Space form.
